page.title: 14The aerial or pylon, Ousden
page.content: It was proposed during 1984-5 that a pylon or aerial should be erected on the outskirts of Ousden on a site known locally as the pightle. Although this was a piece of scrub land with trees not used for housing or farmland and was in an isolated position planning permission had to be obtained from the paris, district and county councils. It was turned down by all 3 as it was felt that it would not be in keeping with the surrounding countryside. The company involved, an in-car telephone company then appealed to the Ministry of the Environment for permission which was granted. It will now be possible for construction to go ahead despite the views of the councillors. A great deal of resentment was felt locally about this and other matters of local importance when locals are ignored by government.
